reviews.review: The original Portal, whilst it's now several years old and has a superior sequel, it's still a blast to sit back for an hour and a bit and partake once again in the dessert (not cake though, because we all know what that is) that is "Portal".
Hands down my favorite single player experience, served up beautifully by the folks at Valve. Anyone can enjoy this w/ a quick 3 hours play through. Don't miss this masterpiece.
The game that started one of the greatest games ever
This is a cool game. Challenging puzzles, and a cool ending. Plus, the game is funny. The robot in charge is always saying something humorous. And at the end, during the credits, she sings a song.
One of the best games ever created check it out if you havent already and then play portal 2 you will enjoy yourself immensely.

I tried this when it was first released in 2007 and quit within 15 minutes - I couldn't get my head around it; but after playing completing Portal 2 (which introduces the game mechanics much better than this version), I tried Portal 1 again and breezed through it.  It's much too short, but still a blast.  Portal 2 is better, but it was cool to see how it all started.
Everyone should play Portal!
Ótimo jogo.

Genauso wie Portal 2 einfach eins der geilsten Games EVER!!!!
Aber im 1. Teil is die Story ... naja ... SEEEEEHR kurz!
I shouldn't really need to recommend this, as everyone else already has, but I'm going to anyway in case someone takes my lack of recommendation seriously.
A very unique game in the FPS genre. The only one that rewards thinking

Um dos melhores FPS ever. A ideia de manipular portais para resolver puzzles é perfeita, e a física do jogo é muito interessante. Pena que seja um tanto curto, mas isso definitivamente não o brilho do jogo.

Play it.  Play it.  Play it.  That's all there is to really say about Portal.  A simple idea of going in one portal and coming out of another goes really far and you should enjoy every minute of the game.
owns
A game that is the epitome of "short and sweet", Portal should be in everyone's library.

[Part One of Two]

The World of Portals, that's how I like to call it. After all you are Chell, the mute with the device that makes handsome portals you can slip through and be creative with. In these two games, you are presented with logic, humour and fun as you progress through hours of story driven ideals and twists.

Okay, Portal One wasn't that much of a story driver, however its important to take into consideration and you'll understand the concept more clearly once you've proceeded into Portal Two. GLaDOS is always present and with you, in the first game, she's (Yes, why are most deviously invented A.I's always female?) the one you'll be listening to for advice and comfort as you solve her purpose built maze... I mean chambers full of fun puzzles for you to solve.

Each game has its own flair and unique ways of interaction between you (Chell) and GLaDOS (Enviroment).

- Continued with Portal 2 Review.
#2 is better
Definitely way too short (< 5 hours) and some of the test chambers made me feel like I'm motor challenged, but ultimately nice and entertaining.

なんじゃこれむっさむずこいんやけど
クリアしてないけどあたかもクリアしたかのように
知り合いの会話に入っていくのもまた至難の業

Years later, I still find myself coming back to portal. Tight controls, fantastic humor, a short runtime, and a glimpse into the golden age of Valve make it worth playing and replaying. NameBrand.

My fourth time through Portal, and I still enjoy it. It's hard to believe it's been so long since its release alongside the orange box... while it isn't necessarily as jaw dropping as it was the first time, I still enjoyed the experience.

It plays different when you remember all of the rooms. Where the first few times I might have actively struggled with the puzzles, now it's almost like... a walking simulator. I get to enjoy the voice lines from GlaDOS. I go out of my way to re-read the ratman drawings. I try to see how infinite of a fall I can get into. It's a museum where I can gather my thoughts about previous playthroughs and think about how crazy modern day Valve is, and why they would let so many of their franchises die of old age.

And I enjoy it! I really do. This time around I finally cracked into the advanced levels and beat those. What a rush! Some of them are plain unfair, but it was a welcome challenge after all these years of just playing the main game to completion again. Next time around maybe I'll break into the time trials or whatever.

If you've never played it, it's a must play. You just have to experience it for yourself. Pales in comparison to Portal 2, so much so that it's almost like a demo of what's to come, but it's such a small commitment (playtime wise) that even if you don't like it, you'll find it was worth experiencing.

(Played great on SteamDeck)
Le meilleur Puzzle Game du monde, tout simplement !
Now you're thinking with portals!  Make the impossible...  easy!  Seriously great game that really makes you think!

If you don't already own Portal, then the only thing I can say is, "What the hell is wrong with you???" Seriously. 1.) This game is something special. It brought something new to the genre of FPS gaming, and that new thing is also wonderful. 2.) It has been on extreme sale, not to mention outright free, numerous times, and it most certainly will be again. If you have qualms about the $10 price tag, then just wait until the next big Steam sale and get it for peanuts. 

This game is worth it for EVERYONE, even those who aren't "gamers". It makes you think in entirely new ways, the gameplay is easy and fun, the humor is quirky and hilarious, and the voicing of the antagonist is bar none. If you don't ever get this game, then your file might as well say, "Unlikeable. Liked by no one. It's right here. Very official."

Tired of the typical? Portal offers you a new way to play with an interesting story to tell. Solve clever puzzles to make your way through 19 stages in an unsettlingly short 1-2 hour game. However, apart from the short playthrough, it will offer you one of the most original, most memorable experiences any game can offer you today. Crisp graphics, cunning physics and applications of it's core features; it does an excellent job at making you look at games in a different way. If you haven't played it already, do it as soon as you can. 9 / 10
You have to play this before playing the sequel! On the PC it's a price you can't refuse!
you need to play this before you play portal 2. it's so worth it.
Für ein kostenloses Spiel verdammt gut. Allerdings hätte ich hierfür niemals Geld ausgegeben.

So innovative, hilarious and amazing. A MUST buy!

If you want a quick game with fun puzzles and some humor in the background, you want Portal. And if you like it, go ahead and ge Portal 2 as well because it turns everything up a notch!
Fairly short, but seriously amazing. Lets just say I'm looking to get the sequal
Un juego estupendo. Gran ingenio, mucho humor, Valve 100%

"Portal - Sie sind das Versuchskaninchen!"

Portal (1) ist ein von Valve entwickeltes Einzelspieler-Spiel. In dem Spiel spielen sie Chell, eine junge Frau die eine Portalkanone im Auftrag von der Firma  "Aperture Science" testen soll.

Was ist an Portal so faszinierend? Auch wenn es um die Portalkanone geht ist ihre pirmär Waffe ihr Verstand. Denn um Portal durch zu spielen brauchen sie Köpfchen.
Außerdem bietet Portal auch noch ein weiteres Highlight die KI die einen quasi durch alle Test "begleitet" kommentiert alles auf humorvolle und bösartige Weise.

Mir ging es nie wirklich darum Portal durchzuspielen mir ging und geht es darum Portal zu erleben. Es gibt immer neue Wege und immer eine andere Möglichkeit den erhaltenen Spieltrieb aus zu Leben!

Von mir erhällt Portal 5/5 Sternen.
★ ★ ★ ★ ★ 
Es ist  innovativ und lustig!
If you haven't heard of this game, where have you been? If you haven't played this game, what are you waiting for?

I don't know anyone who doesn't already own Portal, but I guess on the off chance that someone out there has been stuck in a test chamber for the past half of a decade I'll write the review anyway. Portal, much like Human Centipede, is meant to make you start thinking about life with portals. The game is pretty easy (although you will get stuck on a few rooms your first time through) but the reason it's gotten so much widespread praise is due to the story telling. There are no text boxes telling you what to feel and there's certainly no cinematics showing you what you need to feel -- you directly experience it through the mental anguish caused by the insideous AI GLaDOS. This is the best writing you will ever experience in any medium. The graphics push the source engine a good deal, to boot. This is one of those games that will be remembered as one of the best games ever made.
A great puzzle/action game. I recommend to all people liking comedy, action, and brain twisting challenges.

If you haven't played it yet, here's what you do:

1. Talk to me since I have two free copies that seem impossible to give away.
2. Play the game.
3. Love it.

Originally released in a game set called the Orange Box back in October 9, 2007' Portal is a first-person shooter that utilizes the portal gun (and portals) to solve puzzles. I decided to try this game because of the revolutionary idea of portals and applying the concept of ripping wormholes to travel from one destination to another. This game takes physicals to a whole new level, perhaps even exaggerated because you cannot die from gravity acceleration of infinite. Yet it's these physics, puzzles and dead-pan humor of your nemesis that truly makes Portal a great stand alone game. My only complaint would be that it could have utilized gravity rooms to create even more diverse free-gravity game. Another problem is that because portals allow you to travel in any dimension, there can be too many ways to beat the game, making it rather too easy. Valve should start hiring physicists to make a different Portal game. Portal 2, rather fell short in my opinion, not as great and revolutionary.

Geniales Logic & Rätsel Spiel, freu mich schon auf Portal 2 .
Physikalische Umsetzung ist auch sehr gut gelungen.
Ist nicht für Dumpfbacken geeignet xD
Think outside the box? How about folding three dimensions to get out of the box? Who puts people in boxes anyways?

Reasons why Portal is the female version of an FPS: 
1. The main character is female.
2. The main villain is female.
3. Your only weapon is a gun that shoots...VAGINAs--I mean, space-time tunnel apertures.
4. The game is based around evasion and manipulation instead of confrontation and domination.
5. The turrets. They are the exact opposite of a parody of everything women supposedly hate about regular shooting games. Violence, profanity, blood, evil symbolism, chauvinism...the turrets are always polite and apologize even if you kill them. Because everyone is nice in a woman's world.
6. Just like actual women, the main villain (GLaDOS) is actually powerless to physically do anything to you. The only weapon GLaDOS has is emotional manipulation. Just like women.
7. The company is called Aperture Science and women have an aperture between their legs.
8. The game starts and ends with a cute song instead of a bunch of dead people.
9. The game promises you a reward at the end if you jump through a lot of hoops, and it turns out to be a GREAT BIG FUCKING LIE, YOU STUPID WHORE YOU FUCKING USED ME, ROT IN HELL YOU WORTHLESS CUNT, women have been known to stereotypically act in this manner.
Finally...
10. Your only weapon is a gun that shoots VAGINAs.
The original experiment, it might seem low budget now, but it is still worth playing.
An awesome game; one of my favourites. Can't wait for Portal 2!
I promise there will be cake!
Short but amazingly fun.

Based on the 1993 Tim Burton movie of the same name, Portal is a coming-of-age tale centered on a Little League baseball team in the deep south.
Great puzzle game. Must have to anyone with a brain. Play it so you can play Portal 2.

It's pretty much the best game ever. Innovative, visual masterpiece, compelling story...I honestly can't summarize the greatness of this game. Get it NOW!

If you haven't heard of this game then you've probably been living in a cave or something. This game is just plain brilliant. This is a combination of FPS and puzzles. Everyone should try it. And I'm looking forward to Portal 2!
An epic game, worth playing before portal 2 for the story

Одна из лучших компьютерных игр в истории. Описывать игру не никакого смысла, надо просто поиграть в неё. Шедевр, классика, бесподобный сюжет, уникальный саундтрек и GLaDOS, как эталон "черного юмора". В эту игру можно играть вечно, и каждый найдет свой неповторимый способ прохождения. Bravo, Valve!

Groundbreaking installation from Valve. Would recommend it in a heartbeat. Genius idea taken and spun around into an equally genius game.

Portal has a great mix of humor & creepiness, as well as a fresh new concept; a first person shooter with no bullets. (No bullets in your gun, anyways. You still get shot at, in case you were thinking you'd miss that.) 
Mind-bending the first time & still entertaining when you play through again later, it's definitely a game worth buying.

If you haven't played Portal, you've missed out on about the only game in a decade that did something cool and different. It's clever, it's funny, and highly original. You should honestly feel ashamed if you haven't gotten round to playing it yet. Go play it. Now.

Portal is a puzzle game with portals. Its cult status was achieved by the interesting character of GLaDOS and the cynic-morbid humor, not to forget the great song “Still Alive”. As usual, Valve made a great but, unfortunately, short game. 

It is a must buy nonetheless. Also, there will be cake.

If you like challenging puzzles, I hightly reccomend this. Very unique gameplay and story.
basically perfect

First thing first: I hate Half Life. But not because of that I do not appreciate Portal. Take a FPS game and turn it into a creative, fun puzzle game, only Valve can do that. In the game, you own a gun that can create portals to go through. The idea is simple, but the implementation is perfect. And the antagonist is truly hilarious and sarcastic at the same time. On the other hand, the play time is quite short, but you have many challenges to take.
One of the best games of all time, and referenced in so many ways in other games. Just a forewarning: The cake is a lie.
A brilliant, if short game.  It'll make you think while simultaneously making you laugh.  Great stuff.

Speaking of curiosity, you're curious about what happens after you die, right? Guess what? This game knows! You're going to find out first-hand before I can finish telling you, though, so I won't bother. Absolutely fun. I'm not usually a fan of FPS-style games (because I'm ridiculously clumsy at them), but Portal was enjoyable and interesting enough to keep me playing until the end. It's short, but sweet -- although I'll admit the chambers can be somewhat tedious on your first run. It's also great to replay and find alternate solutions to various puzzles. Once you get the hang of thinking with portals, you'll wish you could do it in every game.
Great story. Great lines. Great everything. Buy it now!

Note: This game been tried out and reviewed in Steam offline mode or on Consoles.

Portal: This game is probably one of the most innovative titles of the decade. You play as the female protagonist named Chell. In the beginning of the game, Chell awakes inside of a glass room. A radio playing some upbeat music is the only noise heard until an eerie voice from the Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System (GLaDOS) fills the air. GLaDOS informs Chell about some very valuable tests that need to be performed

Portal is a pure surprise of enjoyment. you will get hooked on this game wishing for more by the end. and this game opens up the door for future implementation in valve games that should be very fun.

Portal is still revolutionary. The challenging puzzles and clever dialog are beautifully mixed together. Plus, the fact that you're able to reach each goal using different methods truly makes the game personal and memorable for each person.
